Package edu.cnm.deepdive.security

Class Diceware

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.security.Diceware

  • public class Diceware
extends Object
    The Diceware class generates a passphrase using a word list provided in the constructor. Will use a defualt RNG if not provided an external one.
    Author:
    jake_

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Diceware.InsufficientPoolException
      An exception that occurs when there are not enough words to make a passphrase of requested length.

      Intializes an instance of Diceware using a reference to a ResourceBundle as the source for the word list.

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      String[] generate​(int length)
      Allows for consumer to just specify length of passphrase parameter and assign defualt value of true to duplicatesAllowed parameter.

      • Diceware

        public Diceware​()

      • Diceware

        public Diceware​(File file)
         throws FileNotFoundException,
                IOException
        Intializes an instance of Diceware using a reference to a File object. If the File does not exist, of cannot be read, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        file - file to read for word list.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if file does not exist.
        IOException - if file can't be read.

      • Diceware

        public Diceware​(Collection<String> source)
        Intializes an instance of Diceware using a Collection as the source of words for the word list.
        Parameters:
        source - word list source.

      • Diceware

        public Diceware​(ResourceBundle bundle)
        Intializes an instance of Diceware using a reference to a ResourceBundle as the source for the word list. (Keys/names are igonored).
        Parameters:
        bundle - resource bundle to provide words for word list.

    • Method Detail

      • getRng

        public Random getRng​()
              throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Returns a RNG to select words from wordlist if no RNG is provided.
        Returns:
        Returns a RNG.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If lazy initialization is used can throw this exception.

      • setRng

        public void setRng​(Random rng)
        Sets a reference to an RNG to be used to select words from the word list.
        Parameters:
        rng - RNG to get words from word list.

      • generate

        public String[] generate​(int length,
                         boolean duplicatesAllowed)
                  throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                         Diceware.InsufficientPoolException,
                         IllegalArgumentException
        Generates a passphrase of the specified length, the use of duplicates is controlled by duplicatesAllowed parameter. If the provided word list has less words than the specified passphrase length and duplicates aren't allowed, an infinite loop will occur.
        Parameters:
        length - Desired length of passphrase.
        duplicatesAllowed - If passphrase can have duplicate words.
        Returns:
        returns a String[] that shows words selected for passphrase.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If lazy initialization is used can throw this exception.
        Diceware.InsufficientPoolException - If password length exceeds words list, and duplicates not allowed or worldlist has no words.
        IllegalArgumentException - If requested length isn't positive.

      • generate

        public String[] generate​(int length)
                  throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                         Diceware.InsufficientPoolException,
                         IllegalArgumentException
        Allows for consumer to just specify length of passphrase parameter and assign defualt value of true to duplicatesAllowed parameter.
        Parameters:
        length - Desired length of passphrase.
        Returns:
        returns a String[] that shows words selected for passphrase.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If lazy initialization is used can throw this exception.
        Diceware.InsufficientPoolException - If worldlist has no words.
        IllegalArgumentException - If requested length is negative.

      • generate

        public String generate​(int length,
                       String delimiter)
                throws Diceware.InsufficientPoolException,
                       NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                       IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        length - Desired length of passphrase.
        delimiter - Character that seperates the words in the passphrase.
        Returns:
        returns a String that shows words selected for passphrase.
        Throws:
        Diceware.InsufficientPoolException - If worldlist is too small.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If lazy initialization is used can throw this exception.
        IllegalArgumentException - If requested length is negative.

      • generate

        public String generate​(int length,
                       String delimiter,
                       boolean duplicatesAllowed)
                throws Diceware.InsufficientPoolException,
                       NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                       IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        length - Desired length of passphrase.
        delimiter - Character that seperates the words in the passphrase.
        duplicatesAllowed - If passphrase can have duplicate words.
        Returns:
        returns a String that shows words selected for passphrase.
        Throws:
        Diceware.InsufficientPoolException - If worldlist is too small.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If lazy initialization is used can throw this exception.
        IllegalArgumentException - If requested length is negative.
